metadata.Title: CVE-2023-2163 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description: Incorrect verifier pruning in BPF in Linux Kernel >=5.4 leads to unsafecode paths being incorrectly marked as safe, resulting in arbitraryread/write in kernel memory, lateral privilege escalation, and containerescape.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
